frameDefinitions: In this frame a Speaker ceases speaking, sometimes about a particular Topic.
A Self_mover intentionally moves in a Directionon a Path relative to landmark that is neither the Source nor the Goal of the overall motion.
A Questioner asks a Witness (or defendant) questions in the context of a court procedure.

This frame consists of words that indicate that an Agent or a Cause affects the position of an Item on some scale (the Attribute) to change it from an initial value (Value_1) to an end value (Value_2).
An Agent changes a Part of a complex entity with regard to some Feature in order to achieve some Imposed_purpose affected by the Feature.
An Agent enacts an Action that is intended to be performed again at one or more later Occasions.
frameExamples: Finally, Jan <t>shut</t> <t>up</t> about his car accident.
Ambrose Powell <t>forded</t> over on one horse, and we drove the others after him.
We 'd like to <t>cross-examine</t> the witness if we can.
The company is <t>raising</t> the final dividend from 4.34p to 4.57p, to boost the total by 5.3 percent to 6.36p.
I need to <t>adjust</t> the thermostat to around 80 degrees when she visits.
I <t>practiced</t> my song for the play.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> has previously been speaking but has now stopped.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the <fen>Speaker</fen>'s voice or other communicative noise emitted by the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the becoming silent occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location where the becoming silent occurs.
This is a sentient being or a vehicle steered by a sentient being which moves.
Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>.
Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>, excluding directional expressions:
Any expression which indicates where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element <fen>Goal</fen>.
The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>, taken simultaneously.
The direction in which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> goes.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
The individual who asks a <fen>Witness</fen> questions.
A person who is present in a courtroom in order to give some form of evidence, has been sworn in, and is being examined by a <fen>Questioner</fen>.
When the examination occurs.
Where the examination takes place.
The person who causes an entity (Item) to change its positon on a scale with respect to some property (Variable).
The scale along which the <fen>Item</fen> ranges in value.
The entity whose position along a scale is being changed.
The force that causes the change.
When the event occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the value of an <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The individual that controls the value of a <fen>Feature</fen>.
The part of the complex entity which is changed in the process of adjusting.
The <fen>Feature</fen> with respect to which the <fen>Part</fen> is adjusted.
The time at which the adjusting occurs.
The location where the adjusting takes place.
This role identifies the <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally in order to prepare for a later <fen>Occasion</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the <fen>Action</fen> in preparation for later performances of the same type.
The later enactment or enactments that the <fen>Agent</fen> expects to perform. Note that the <fen>Agent</fen> does not have to have specific <fen>Occasion</fen>s in mind.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> practices.
This role identifies the place where the practicing occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The children</fex> finally quieted down.
<fex>The excited chatter</fex> hushed.
<fex>We</fex> drive down dusty roads, forded through a stream, and tried to get up a mountainside on a rocky road.
We forded <fex>from the island</fex> to the mainland.
We decided to cut <fex>through the forest</fex>.
I'll cut across the Sahara desert <fex>up to Algeria and Morocco</fex>.
We followed the trail (which is well marked with cairns) and then cut <fex>west</fex> across a grassy meadow for about 1000 feet to the crest of  the nearby saddle lying below North Peak.
The Federal Army of the Potomac forded the river <fex>in August 1862</fex>.
The common brook is best forded <fex>south of the hut</fex>.
You have leave to examine <fex>the witness.</fex>
They increased <fex>the price of oil</fex>.
<fex>Oil</fex> prices were raised yesterday.
<fex>The rain</fex> increased the river's flow rate to an astonishing million gallons per second.
As a result, they raised prices <fex>in Peoria</fex>.
She adjusted <fex>the injectors</fex> to make the mixture leaner.
She adjusted <fex>the temperature of the oven</fex> so that the pie crust would brown a little.
Little Dieter practiced <fex>playing the piano</fex> all day.
<fex>For our brother's wedding</fex> we had to rehearse the dinner twenty times.
We practiced the play <fex>on Tuesday</fex>.
Our band practices <fex>on the football field</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Disc 3 of the Blade Runner: Ultimate Collection
Future Noir: The Making of Blade Runner
Planet of the Apes and Alien
